thread.title: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: White leads Pioneers' selections
thread.title_full: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: White leads Pioneers' selections

author: From Facts staff reports
title: ALL-DISTRICT FOOTBALL: White leads Pioneers' selections
text:
Iowa Colony made it a round farther in the UIL playoffs in 2024 than its previous trip despite moving up in classification.
The Pioneers reached the postseason for the second time in three seasons, placing second in District 9-5A, Division 2 play with a 6-1 record. The Pioneers finished 12-2 overall.
The Pioneers took District 9 champion and eventual Class 5A, Division 2 state champion Randle down to the wire in a Region 3 championship overtime loss at NRG Stadium.
Before running into the Lions, the Pioneers beat Killeen Ellison in the opening round of the playoffs, followed by Pflugerville and district opponent Fort Bend Marshall in a regional semifinal.
Randle (7-0, 16-0) won the district and the state championship in its third varsity season, followed by Iowa Colony, Marshall (5-2, 10-3) and Texas City (4-3, 5-5).
The Pioneers littered the all-district football list, including a pair of superlative honors.
Last season’s newcomer of the year, Carson White, earned the district’s offensive most valuable player honor and offensive lineman Chukwuemeka Tasie was the offensive sophomore of the year.
Other superlative honors included Randle’s Landen Williams-Callis, running back, as the district's most valuable player, Chase Sims was named the defensive MVP, Carey Spires was the defensive newcomer, Patrick Oliver was the co-defensive sophomore of the year, and Brian Randle was the coach of the year; Fort Bend Marshall receiver Jordan Simmons was the offensive newcomer and Ashton Lofton was the co-defensive sophomore of the year; Lamar Consolidated’s Samuel Johnson was the co-freshman of the year; Texas City’s Cardae King was co-offensive freshman of the year; Santa Fe’s Teagan Woitna was co-defensive freshman of the year; and Baytown Lee’s Nehemiah Louisy was co-defensive freshman of the year.
First-team offensive selections for Iowa Colony included linemen Jayden Simmons, Adrian Clark-El and Tasie, receivers Jacody Miles, Jayden Warren and Antoine Martin Jr., White, quarterback, Aaron Tenner, running back, Andy Cruz, kicker, and Will Terry, deep snapper.
Other first-teamers included Randle’s Chance Hernandez, center, linemen Chris Taylor and Nicholas Ortiz, receivers DaCorian Rubin and Sean Smith, Mason Mixon, tight end, Sincere Timpson, running back, and Christian Munguia, kicker; Santa Fe’s Kaden Schirck, lineman, and Bryce Horner, tight end; Baytown Lee’s Ricarri Blow, lineman, Olwen Cuevas, lineman, John Thompson, H-back and tight end, Elijah Brown, receiver, and Josiah Joseph, quarterback; Terry’s Angel Shimkus, lineman; Marshall’s Blake Chacier, lineman, receivers Ja’Kayden Ferguson, Andre Feast, Ja’Kyron Edmonds and Simmons, Kaeden Johnson, quarterback, Peyton Long, running back, Tamir Williams, kicker, and John Stegall, deep snapper; and Lamar Consolidated’s Hunter Perry, receiver, Kameron Daliet, receiver, and Edgar Garcia, tight end.
First-team defensive selections for Iowa Colony included Daniel Swiney, lineman, Chris Johnson, defensive end, Adrian Porter, inside linebacker, Haydon Caston, outside linebacker, Jarvis Solomon, cornerback, Chandler Love, safety, Cruz, punter, and Miles, returner.
Other selections included Baytown Lee’s Nate Stewart, lineman, Rylan Barrientos, defensive end, Joseph Turner, defensive end, Thompson, inside linebacker, Elijah Brown, cornerback, and Denzel Taylor, safety; Terry’s Shimkus, lineman, Dameon Sims, defensive end, Jordan Randle, defensive end, and Robert Shaw, punter; Marshall’s Jakobi Davis, lineman, Lonnieb Feagins, defensive end, Dectric Brown, lineman, Lofton, outside linebacker, Caleb Chester, cornerback, Williams, punter, and Dazjhon Taylor, returner; Lamar Consolidated’s Dre’Sean Cobbin, lineman, and Isaiah Cobbin, returner; Randle’s L’Jaelan Miller, lineman, Wayne Kelly, defensive end, Spires, defensive end, Te’Shawn Williams, inside linebacker, Ja’Quin Parker, inside linebacker, Jaylon Burton, outside linebacker, Ryan Mallory, outside linebacker, Blake Thompson, cornerback, Patrick Oliver, cornerback, Sh’Rhod Revis, safety, Sebastian Garza, safety, and returners Timpson, Da’Corian Rubin and Smith; and Texas City’s Kaden Clay, inside linebacker, Royal Mack, outside linebacker, Tristen Blackmon, cornerback, Xavier Skowron, safety, and Michael Saltz, safety.
Second-team offensive honors for Iowa Colony included Tyson Windham, center, Aeden Elizondo, lineman, and Eric Mosley III, running back.
Other honorees included Marshall’s Ja’Vein Mitchell, center, D’Sean Harris, lineman, and Durell Taylor, running back; Baytown Lee’s Angel Ochoa, center, Luis Gonzales, lineman, Dylan Edwards, running back, and Andres Guzman, kicker; Santa Fe’s Gerardo Rodriguez, center; Terry’s Chris Martinez, lineman, Mathew Eben, H-back, Everett Gary, quarterback, Eric Wheeler, running back, and, Joaquin Plasencia, deep snapper; Randle’s Logan Reed, lineman, Eugene Gardner, lineman; receivers Keilan Sweeny, Jaxon Montalongo and Cedrick McClintock, and Sweeny, quarterback; Texas City’s Maurice Burton, running back, Justin Stephens, running back, and Travis Peveto, deep snapper; and Lamar Consolidated’s Larry Clinton, running back.
Second-team honorees for Iowa Colony included Michael Howard, lineman, Henry Kalu, inside linebacker, and Jeremy Garner, safety.
Other second-team selections included Texas City’s Izeriyan Sweed, lineman, Tre Lampkin, lineman, Dustin Taylor, lineman, Justin Stephens, inside linebackers, Patrick Evans, outside linebackers, Burton, cornerback, and Evans, punter; Baytown Lee’s Aiden Squires, lineman, Remundo Navarro, inside linebacker, and Adrian Mondragon, punter; Marshall’s Terrion Bailey-Speights, lineman, Kendrick Orji, defensive end, Trence Whitsey, defensive end, A’Mari Harris, inside linebacker, Dylan Waters, cornerback, and Myles Ratcliff, cornerback; Randle’s Cameron Hypolite, lineman, and Perry Kindrid, outside linebackers; Santa Fe’s Johnathan Baccinelli, defensive end, and Jaiden Bailey, inside linebackers; and Lamar Consolidated’s Trevor Onuegbu, defensive end, Kenneth Rhone, cornerback, Elijah Gonzales, safety, and Daliet, returner.
Honorable mention players for Iowa Colony included Zeldyn Golden, outside linebacker, Micario Brackins, cornerback, Ian Hill, receiver, Noah Smith, offensive lineman, Treshaun O’Neal, outside linebacker.
Pioneers who were named academic all-district include Robert Ardoin, Corey Anthony, Denim Barnes, Caston, Avery Hanson, Howard, Aaron Hernandez, Elizondo, Martin, Miles, Simmons, Smith, Tasie, Warren, Windham, Mikah Woods and Donald Wynn.
